ticket.title: Bad Content Type Error in Rack 1.0
ticket.original-body:
I have posted my issue already in Ticket #1875. Because the Ticket has been closed I think, that no one has an eye on it.
So here is a new one:
Its about the Error, that occurs while uploading a file (in my case a video m4v) within a multipart form in Rails 2.3.2. Evgeniy Pirogov said that this issue has been fixed in Rack 1.0, but it seems that the error still occurs.
The upload runs into errors on a Linux Gentoo Machine. On Max OS X all is fine.
Rails Version is 2.3.2, Mongrel 1.5. Ruby 1.8.
Has anybody a solution for this issue?
Joshua: Because you whas the responsible Guy in the last ticket I have added you here. Sry if it is not right.
Best Regards. Simon
Trace:

ticket.original-body-html:
I have posted my issue already in Ticket #1875. Because the Ticket has been closed I think, that no one has an eye on it.

So here is a new one:

Its about the Error, that occurs while uploading a file (in my case a video m4v) within a multipart form in Rails 2.3.2. Evgeniy Pirogov said that this issue has been fixed in Rack 1.0, but it seems that the error still occurs.

The upload runs into errors on a Linux Gentoo Machine. On Max OS X all is fine.

Rails Version is 2.3.2, Mongrel 1.5. Ruby 1.8.

Has anybody a solution for this issue?

Joshua: Because you whas the responsible Guy in the last ticket I have added you here. Sry if it is not right.

Best Regards. Simon

I have posted my issue already in Ticket #1875. Because the Ticket has been closed I think, that no one has an eye on it.
So here is a new one:
Its about the Error, that occurs while uploading a file (in my case a video m4v) within a multipart form in Rails 2.3.2. Evgeniy Pirogov said that this issue has been fixed in Rack 1.0, but it seems that the error still occurs.
The upload runs into errors on a Linux Gentoo Machine. On Max OS X all is fine.
Rails Version is 2.3.2, Mongrel 1.5. Ruby 1.8.
Has anybody a solution for this issue?
Joshua: Because you whas the responsible Guy in the last ticket I have added you here. Sry if it is not right.
Best Regards. Simon

I have posted my issue already in Ticket #1875. Because the Ticket has been closed I think, that no one has an eye on it.

So here is a new one:

Its about the Error, that occurs while uploading a file (in my case a video m4v) within a multipart form in Rails 2.3.2. Evgeniy Pirogov said that this issue has been fixed in Rack 1.0, but it seems that the error still occurs.

The upload runs into errors on a Linux Gentoo Machine. On Max OS X all is fine.

Rails Version is 2.3.2, Mongrel 1.5. Ruby 1.8.

Has anybody a solution for this issue?

Joshua: Because you whas the responsible Guy in the last ticket I have added you here. Sry if it is not right.

Best Regards. Simon

version.title: Bad Content Type Error in Rack 1.0

version.body:
Unpacked the latest version of rack with those fixes:
http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/25fde77674cd6f9906b7a8e7eef046f06698c02a
